abstract: Guatemalan government arrests 18 former high-ranking military officers suspected of committing atrocities in 1980s during country's civil war; move puts pressure on president-elect Jimmy Morales, whose political party has significant number of former officers.

headline.main: Guatemala Arrests Former Military Officers in Connection With Massacres

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The authorities arrested 18 former officers on charges related to massacres and disappearances in the 1980s, the bloodiest period of the country’s 36-year civil war.
lead_paragraph: The authorities arrested 18 former officers on charges related to massacres and disappearances in the 1980s, the bloodiest period of the country’s 36-year civil war.
